articles.title: United States decides to donate food to DPRK
articles.content:
United States decides to donate food to DPRK 
    Pyongyang, February 27 (KCNA) -- The U.S. Government on Feb. 25 decided to donate 100,000 tons of food to the DPRK this year through the World Food Program.

Honorary citizenship to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Honorary citizenship to Kim Jong Il 
    Pyongyang, February 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il was awarded an honorary citizenship by Lince district, Lima, Peru. Cesar Gonzalez Arrivasplata, governor of the district, handed certificate of an honorary citizen to the DPRK Ambassador to Peru with due ceremony on Feb. 18.
 The governor said that Kim Jong Il, a great thinker and theoretician and a distinguished political activist, is greatly contributing to the progress and prosperity of humankind and the development of friendly and cultural ties with the world people.    
 We will make positive efforts to further promote friendship with the Korean people and expand economic and cultural exchanges in the future, he stressed.
